channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Lots of people love tennis. But do you know where it comes from?
item.description: Recent years have seen an upswing in people playing tennis (or at least dressing like it). But it's not just a phase. The sport — at least some versio...

item.title: A battle is unfolding in Europe over the future of wolves
item.description: Europe recently downgraded the protected status of wolves, sparking concern among conservationists who warn this may undo decades of progress and lead...

item.title: Greetings from Damascus, Syria, where a crowded bar welcomed post-Assad revelers
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Over 160 people still missing after Texas floods. And, federal layoffs can now resume
item.description: The death toll for the Texas floods tops 100 as the search and rescue efforts continue for over 160 missing people. And, the Supreme Court is allowing...

item.title: State laws to stop surprise ambulance bills face pushback from insurers
item.description: Policymakers agree patients shouldn't be stuck in the middle when an ambulance service charges more than what an insurer will pay. But they can't sett...

item.title: 'Shoot in the leg' - Kenyan leader orders police to curb violent protests
item.description: Government will not stand by and watch businesses and lives destroyed by sponsored rioters, Ruto says.

item.title: Focus on first responders’ mental health grows as death toll rises in flood-ravaged Texas
Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals
item.description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, we show you items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage...

item.title: Extended interview: MARINA on why she took a break from music, her transformative new album, more
item.description: British indie pop icon MARINA tells CBS News' Anthony Mason about the inspiration and detailed planning behind her sixth album, "Princess of Power," a...

item.title: US cuts visa validity for most Nigerian applicants
item.description: The United States announces sweeping changes to its non-immigrant visa policy for Nigeria.

item.title: Elon Musk tells tech analyst Dan Ives to "Shut up"
item.description: Elon Musk told Dan Ives to "shut up" after he made recommendations to Tesla's board on X.

item.title: Moscow shrugs off Trump's irritation with Putin
item.description: On Ukraine, Vladimir Putin wants more than Donald Trump has been prepared to offer, writes BBC Russia editor Steve Rosenberg.

item.title: How Americans think the government should respond to natural disasters, according to recent polls

item.description: Four carton sizes were recalled due to individually wrapped packs that may be incorrectly labeled as "cheese" even though they may contain peanut butt...

item.description: Crews are using backhoes and their bare hands to dig through piles of debris that stretch for miles in the search for more than 160 people believed to...

item.title: Ukraine suffers heaviest attack as Trump criticises Putin
item.description: The US president reverses a suspension of weapons shipments to Kyiv and heavily criticises Russia's Putin.

item.title: French police raid on National Rally HQ prompts outrage from party leaders
item.description: Party president Jordan Bardella complains of an "unprecedented operation", as prosecutors investigate alleged fraud.

item.title: Can I keep my shoes on at the airport? What to know about TSA rule change.
item.description: As of Tuesday, passengers at U.S. airports are no longer required to remove their shoes during the TSA screening process.
